It was awful. It took forever to get out of the building because the cops LET the protesters harras people as we walked out the doors. Cops just stood there watching. They were screaming and cursing, threatening all of us. We had to exit RIGHT INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEARLY 1000 Protesters.

Be a problem or be a part of the solution by doing something. protesting on the highway, blocking traffic and inconveniencing the people who have nothing to do with the problem is not solving anything it is however causing another problem... how about doing something to solve the crime both in the Brigham's in the police force?? No you'd rather point out someone else's problems, get out and do something positive instead of causing more problems. I don't have to ask you anything, I wanted your perspective but you've proven you don't have a perspective but are just on the bandwagon wanting attention without and drive to make a difference.

Unless is your Nth wedding... Get yourself a wedding photographer (not just any photographer, an actual wedding photographer!). It is after all, a once (or twice, or thrice for some?) in a lifetime event that you want to have amazing pictures of and while yes your family and friends will take photos and all, do you seriously want to leave it to chance? It is hard work, it takes skill, it takes education and practice. Save expenses somewhere else: invite a couple less people, get another venue, maybe even go for other flower arrangements, etc but definitely don't skimp on the photographer!

Sleep deprivation will seriously mess with your mind. I went years with a sleep disorder and eventually went to a neurologist because I thought was having signs of dementia or something because my memory was horrible. After testing and MRI to rule out other possibilities she suggested I get my stress and sleep problems under control.After trying several things that had bad side effects and left me feeling like a zombie someone suggested essential oils. Bingo! It didn't happen overnight but over the next couple months of trying different combinations my sleep cycle corrected itself. It had made a world of difference in my mind functioning. I don't think people realize how much long term sleep issues can impact your brain. Sorry about the long story but thought it's something really important to think about.
